comment.author: 22081583@N06
comment._content: A regular passenger service from Conway to Trefriw was started in 1847 by the St. George Steam Packet Company. "St. Winifred" was the first paddle steamer, joined in c.1880 by the "St. George".

comment.author: 41675580@N08
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Nautical pictures of interest., and we'd love to have this added to the group! A nice little picture of a long gone ship.
